intro: Lappula tianschanica var. tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its adaptations to harsh climatic conditions.
